alert.note: Alert for Kent; Montcalm; Newaygo (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 8:54PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Michigan, southwest Michigan and west central Michigan, including the following counties, in central Michigan, Montcalm. In southwest Michigan, Kent. In west central Michigan, Newaygo. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 853 PM EDT, Radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain has already fallen, with some reports of as much as 4 inches of rain over the last few hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville, Stanton, Rockford, Howard City, Edmore, Lakeview, Cedar Springs, Croton, Sidney, Sheridan, Sand Lake, McBride, Pierson, Gowen, Trufant, Turk Lake, Lincoln Lake, Langston, Coral and Greenville Municipal Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
